explanation: The report is not correct. The mhd_assert(...) call is an explicit runtime diagnostic check (via a macro) that can have observable behaviour in builds where asserts are enabled (typically abort/log on failure). Rule 2.2 forbids code that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour. Removing an assertion that can abort or otherwise report an invariant violation would change program behaviour in those builds, so it is not dead code in general. Even if, by API contract, the condition should always hold, that does not automatically make the check dead — it is a defensive diagnostic used to detect contract violations. Also, whether the macro expands to nothing in some build configurations does not by itself make the source line “dead code” for the project: the check is conditionally active and can affect behaviour when enabled. Therefore the agent A’s claim that this assertion constitutes dead code under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 is unjustified.
